description: This classic cherry pie brings back memories of grandma's kitchen with every bite. Its flaky crust and sweet-tart filling make it a timeless dessert. Bake one today and share the joy with your loved ones!
ingredients: 2 cups fresh or frozen cherries, pitted
1 tablespoon butter, cut into small pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cherries, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and vanilla extract. Mix well and let sit for 10 minutes.
Roll out one pie crust and place it in a 9-inch pie pan. Fill with the cherry mixture and dot with butter.
Cover with the second pie crust, seal the edges, and cut slits for steam to escape.
Brush the top with beaten egg and sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for 40-45 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling.
tips: For a perfectly flaky crust, keep your ingredients cold and avoid overworking the dough.

structured_content.content: This Old-Fashioned Cherry Pie is a delightful treat that captures the essence of home baking. With its buttery crust and sweet-tart cherry filling, it evokes warm memories of family gatherings and celebrations.

structured_content.content: Growing up, my grandma would make this cherry pie every summer when the cherries were in season. The smell of it baking would fill the house, and we couldn't wait to dig in!

• Main ingredient: Fresh or frozen cherries work best for a juicy filling; make sure they are pitted.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Lemon juice brightens the flavor, while vanilla adds depth.
  • Supporting ingredients: Sugar balances the tartness of the cherries, and cornstarch thickens the filling.
  • Equipment needed: A pie dish, mixing bowl, and rolling pin are essential for this recipe.

Preparation:

Follow the step-by-step instructions to assemble and bake the pie, ensuring the crust is golden and the filling is bubbling.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Ensure your cherries are well-drained to avoid a soggy crust.
  • A common mistake is not sealing the edges properly, which can lead to filling leakage.
  • Look for a golden brown crust as a cue that it's ready.
  • Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: This pie has been a family favorite for generations, and sharing it with friends brings back the joy of those summer days spent in the kitchen.
Enhance the flavor by adding a pinch of almond extract or mixing in other berries like blueberries or raspberries for a mixed fruit pie.
Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a dollop of whipped cream for a delightful dessert experience.
For a gluten-free option, use a gluten-free pie crust. You can also substitute cherries with peaches or apples for a different twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Chill your pie crust before rolling it out for a flakier texture.
  • Use a mix of sweet and tart cherries for a more complex flavor.
  • Keep an eye on the pie as it bakes to prevent over-browning.
  • Serve with fresh mint for a pop of color and flavor.

structured_content.content: Embrace the joy of baking this cherry pie, and create lasting memories with every slice shared with loved ones!
